metadata.title: CVE-2021-43535 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free could have occured when an HTTP2 session object wasreleased on a different thread, leading to memory corruption and apotentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 93,Thunderbird < 91.3, and Firefox ESR < 91.3.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-43535` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 94.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '94.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
